reply.question: 1. Does the app declare the collection of data?

answer.full_answer: Yes, the app declares the collection of data.

reply.analysis: The privacy policy clearly states that the app collects various types of data including Account Data, Contact Data, Health Data, Preferences Data, and Technical Data.
reply.reference: When you first use the App and open an account, you are required to fill in a questionnaire, which asks for Health Data. By completing this questionnaire you consent to our collection and use of your Health Data information. URL: https://lettheinsideout.com/privacy-policy. The personal details we collect include: Account Data, Contact Data, Health Data, Preferences Data, Technical Data. URL: https://lettheinsideout.com/privacy-policy.

Who Are We?
We are InsideOut25 Limited, a company registered in England.
Our address is: 164 Walkden Road, Worsley, Manchester, M28 7DP.

reply.question: 2. If the app declares the collection of data, what type of data does it collect?

answer.full_answer: The app collects Account Data, Contact Data, Health Data, Preferences Data, and Technical Data.

reply.analysis: The privacy policy explicitly mentions the types of data collected by the app under the 'What Data Do We Collect?' section.
reply.reference: Account Data: Login and account information, including screen name, password and unique user ID; and your use of the service. Contact Data: Contact details including your name, office details, role and work email, as well as the contact details of your emergency contact, should you provide them. Health Data: Data about your health, in particular your mental health, including our counsellor’s observations, details from video sessions, details from messaging chats and safeguarding status. Preferences Data: Personal preferences including your marketing and cookie preferences. Technical Data: When interacting with our App, data is automatically collected and shared with the InsideOut25 technology platforms. More information about these practices is included below. This data includes: device IDs, call state, network access, storage information and battery information, cookies, IP addresses, referrer headers, data identifying your phone and version, and web beacons and tags. URL: https://lettheinsideout.com/privacy-policy

reply.question: 3. Does the app declare the purpose of data collection and use?

answer.full_answer: Yes, the app declares the purpose of data collection and use.

reply.analysis: The privacy policy clearly states that the app declares the purpose of data collection and use, including sharing data with professional advisors, providing updates, and using Health Data solely to provide the services to users.
reply.reference: We may also use Technical Data to understand more about how you use the App and your preferences. We may also need to share data with our professional advisors. For example, to get legal advice, enforce our App Terms or to obtain insurance for our business. If you’ve expressly agreed, we’ll use your contact data to keep you updated about new events and services. URL: https://lettheinsideout.com/privacy-policy

reply.question: 4. Can the user opt out of data collection or delete data?

answer.full_answer: Yes, the user can opt out of data collection or delete data.

reply.analysis: The privacy policy clearly states that users have the right to access, correct, or delete their personal data. Users can also withdraw consent for processing of Health Data, limit processing under specific conditions, and file complaints with the UK Information Commissioner’s Office. Additionally, users can request the deletion of their data at any time.
reply.reference: You have the right to access, correct, or delete your personal data. Withdraw consent for processing of Health Data. Contact us at [email protected] to exercise any of these rights. URL: https://lettheinsideout.com/privacy-policy

How Long Do We Keep Your Data For?

reply.question: 5. Does the app share data with third parties?

answer.full_answer: Yes, the app shares data with counsellors, trusted third-party providers (e.g., AWS, Twilio, OpenAI), emergency services in cases of serious risk, and legal or regulatory bodies if required by law. Health Data is not shared with the employer, except for anonymized attendance statistics.

content: trusted third-party providers (e.g., AWS, Twilio, OpenAI)
emergency services in cases of serious risk
legal or regulatory bodies if required by law

reply.analysis: The privacy policy clearly states that the app shares data with various third parties for specific purposes mentioned in the document.
reply.reference: InsideOut shares your personal data as follows: With counsellors, so they can provide the services you request. With trusted third-party providers (e.g., AWS, Twilio, OpenAI) who process data securely on our behalf. With emergency services in cases where there is a serious risk to life or safety. With legal or regulatory bodies if required by law. We do not share your Health Data with your employer, except to confirm attendance statistics on an anonymised basis. URL: https://lettheinsideout.com/privacy-policy

reply.question: 6. If the app shares data with third parties, what third parties does the app share data with?

answer.full_answer: The app shares data with counsellors, trusted third-party providers (e.g., AWS, Twilio, OpenAI), emergency services in cases of serious risk to life or safety, and legal or regulatory bodies if required by law.

reply.analysis: The app shares data with specific third parties for various purposes mentioned in the privacy policy document.
reply.reference:
InsideOut shares your personal data as follows: 
- With counsellors, so they can provide the services you request. 
- With trusted third-party providers (e.g., AWS, Twilio, OpenAI) who process data securely on our behalf. 
- With emergency services in cases where there is a serious risk to life or safety. 
- With legal or regulatory bodies if required by law. 
URL: https://lettheinsideout.com/privacy-policy
